quest.name: A Final Temptation
journal: Thancred wishes to discuss how to proceed with the investigation.
For want of a better idea, Thancred suggests consulting Fufulupa once more. Speak with the Brass Blade and find out if he has aught to offer.

Upon learning that someone within the Brass Blades' ranks may be involved in the crystal thefts, Thancred and Y'shtola devise a plan to lure the thieves into the open. Posing as a courier in possession of crystals, Y'shtola will act as bait, while you and Thancred observe from a distance. Should the thieves appear, you are to subdue them by any means necessary.

Y'shtola's ruse succeeds in drawing the thieves out into the open, but when the trap is sprung, it quickly becomes clear that they will not be taken alive. Left with no other choice, you fight till each lies dead. Report all that has occurred to Y'shtola.

Although the thieves had naught in their possession to indicate their allegiance, Thancred notes that all were Sea Wolves, and that each of them sported distinctive blue facial tattoos. This observation appears to prompt a revelation in Y'shtola, who immediately takes her leave to make inquiries. Having been placed in charge of matters in Thanalan, Thancred invites you to return with him to Horizon and report to Fufulupa.

Fufulupa informs you that the traitorous Brass Blade was identified while you were away, but that the Lominsan-born Sea Wolf subdued the unit sent to detain him and took flight. Though he assures you that his comrades will soon hunt down the fugitive, you wonder if the task might better be entrusted to one more capable. Before you can volunteer, however, Thancred is informed via linkpearl that your services are needed elsewhere.
objectives: Lie in wait for the thieves.

dialogue.name: THANCRED
dialogue.text: Any bright ideas? A solitary flash of insight?

dialogue.name: THANCRED
dialogue.text: ...No? Well then, for want of a better suggestion, I say we try picking Fufulupa's brain again.

dialogue.name: THANCRED
dialogue.text: Who knows, if we work together, we may yet find something of use nestled away within it.

dialogue.name: YSHTOLA
dialogue.text: Mayhap a more subtle approach is in order...

dialogue.name: THANCRED
dialogue.text: I'm flattered that you enjoy my company so much, Forename, but talking to me isn't going to get us anywhere. Come, let's have a word with Fufulupa.

dialogue.name: FUFULUPA
dialogue.text: Oh, but it is good to see you return! I have given some thought to the matter, and I have just hit upon a most disturbing possibility! How could I have been so blind...!?

dialogue.name: YSHTOLA
dialogue.text: Calm yourself, Fufulupa. What is this disturbing possibility of which you speak?

dialogue.name: FUFULUPA
dialogue.text: I was contemplating as to how the thieves' activities escaped our notice for so long, and then it came to me! What if there is someone among our own ranks conspiring with them─a traitor in our own midst!?

dialogue.name: THANCRED
dialogue.text: ...It would be most unfortunate if your fears proved well founded, Fufulupa.

dialogue.name: YSHTOLA
dialogue.text: Indeed. If, for reasons of security, the Concern decided to transfer the remaining crystals stored in Horizon to another location, their plans would be discovered the moment the Brass Blades were informed.

dialogue.name: THANCRED
dialogue.text: Ah, but such a shipment would surely be well guarded. Would thieves as wily as ours risk open confrontation?

dialogue.name: YSHTOLA
dialogue.text: Mayhap not. But neither would the Concern be eager to present them with such an obvious target. Nay, they might instead elect to carry out the transfer in secret─to entrust the goods to, let us say, a lone Miqo'te miner, traveling without escort so as not to attract undue attention.

dialogue.name: FUFULUPA
dialogue.text: But who─ Ahhh, I see! Yes, the Concern may well elect to do that. But to travel with so much cargo would be a strenuous task indeed, and this miner would certainly need to rest upon the way. Mayhap...north of the bridge to Hammerlea?

dialogue.name: THANCRED
dialogue.text: A fine spot for a rest─would you not agree, Forename? ...Alas, the role of the Miqo'te miner is taken, so you will lie in wait to the north, and I will do the same to the southYou lie in wait to the north, and I shall do the same to the south.

dialogue.name: FUFULUPA
dialogue.text: Ahem! Forgive me, my friends, but I have received new orders! I must inform my men at once!

dialogue.name: THANCRED
dialogue.text: Call me a cynic, but I would be surprised if these thieves lay down their arms and surrender. See that you come prepared to offer them some encouragement.

dialogue.name: THANCRED
dialogue.text: What are you doing, Forename!? If the thieves approach from the north, there will be no one there to stop them!

dialogue.name: YSHTOLA
dialogue.text: Meanin' no offense, misssir─I'd sooner be left in peace.

dialogue.name: POP
dialogue.text: Movement in the distance catches your eye...

dialogue.name: BALLOON
dialogue.text: Guards!? No matter. Kill 'em all!

dialogue.name: BALLOON
dialogue.text: I ain't dyin' in this godsforsaken 'ell'ole!

dialogue.name: THANCRED
dialogue.text: Bumped into the thieves, did you? I don't suppose any of them are still breathing, are they? Hm. I thought not. Well, no sense keeping our miner friend waiting, then.

dialogue.name: YSHTOLA
dialogue.text: Stubborn to the last, as expected. You are unharmed?

dialogue.name: THANCRED
dialogue.text: A gang of Sea Wolf thieves, and in Thanalan, no less. I suppose there's a first time for everything...

dialogue.name: YSHTOLA
dialogue.text: Sea Wolves? All of them?

dialogue.name: THANCRED
dialogue.text: Aye, and all with the same taste in facial tattoos. Blue, in case you were wondering.

dialogue.name: YSHTOLA
dialogue.text: ...Our thieves are a long way from home.

dialogue.name: YSHTOLA
dialogue.text: Thancred─if you would be so good as to attend to the outstanding matters in Horizon... I have inquiries to make.

dialogue.name: THANCRED
dialogue.text: To Horizon, then. Fufulupa will want to hear about your meeting with the thieves.

dialogue.name: THANCRED
dialogue.text: This tale does not require a bard's embellishment. Simply tell Fufulupa what transpired.

dialogue.name: FUFULUPA
dialogue.text: On behalf of the Brass Blades of the Rose, I thank you for your service to Horizon!

dialogue.name: FUFULUPA
dialogue.text: Ah, but we have not been idle! While you were afield, we succeeded in identifying the traitor within our ranks!

dialogue.name: THANCRED
dialogue.text: Is that so? Then, by your leave, I should very much like to have a word with the fellow in private.

dialogue.name: FUFULUPA
dialogue.text: Ah...no. I am afraid that will not be possible. Regrettably, he, um...managed to subdue the unit of Blades dispatched to detain him, and made good his escape.

dialogue.name: THANCRED
dialogue.text: Oh, for the love of─ And how did he manage that, exactly? Your men haven't been sampling that somnus we confiscated, have they? Or was he a giant in disguise?

dialogue.name: FUFULUPA
dialogue.text: N-No...but he was quite strong! A Sea Wolf─Lominsan born and raised, I believe. But do not worry─we will find him, you have my word on that!

dialogue.name: THANCRED
dialogue.text: I see... Pray keep me apprised of any developments.

dialogue.name: THANCRED
dialogue.text: Yes? ...She'sHe's standing next to me. ...Understood.

dialogue.name: THANCRED
dialogue.text: I fear our time together is at an end, my friend. Your services are required elsewhere. Awfully disappointing, I know, but one must follow where duty leads.

dialogue.name: THANCRED
dialogue.text: ...You might try to look a little disappointed! Or do you mean to give me another one of your stoic nods? You do, don't you? <sigh>
